intro: Siler zernyi, commonly known as narrowleaf siler, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its small, clustered flowers are typically pink or purple, blooming in summer. It is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
